definition: county magistrate (during Tang to Qing times)
county
classifier for a ream of paper
see 令狐[Ling2 hu2]
see 脊令[ji2 ling2]
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)

sentences.english: The term of office is an important system for managing the heads of counties in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 任期制是唐代對縣令進行管理的重要措施。

sentences.english: Wang Yuanfeng gets common people support accordingly, should go up the county makes.
sentences.chinese: 王元豐因此得到百姓擁戴，當上縣令。

sentences.english: Long long ago, a county magistrate named Wang Lu worked in present Anhui Province , east China .
sentences.chinese: 從前，有個叫王魯的人在中國東部的安徽作縣令。

sentences.english: Magistrates wife a happy, let nine younger sister asked casually, all her promise.
sentences.chinese: 縣令夫人一開心，就讓九妹隨便提要求，她全部答應。

sentences.english: He was very frightened but he dared not turn down Ying Bin's offer because he was his superior.
sentences.chinese: 他非常害怕，但縣令是他的上司，所以不敢不飲。

sentences.english: The relation between the heads and the local lieges was subtle.
sentences.chinese: 縣令長與地方王侯的關係很微妙。

definition: ancient official title
Ling county in Dezhou 德州[De2 zhou1], Shandong
to commit a crime
Linxiang county-level city in Yueyang 岳陽|岳阳[Yue4 yang2], Hunan
(old) to transport by water/to ship grain as tax
members of the Hanlin Imperial Academy 翰林院, employed as imperial secretaries from the Tang onwards
to promote agriculture
Zhang Juzheng (1525-1582), Grand Secretary during the Ming dynasty, credited with bringing the dynasty to its apogee
to frame sb/to accuse falsely
Minister of War (official title in pre-Han Chinese states)/two-character surname Sima
Tang and Song dynasty provincial governor, in Tang times having military and civil authority, but only civil authority in Song
court examination, the top grade imperial exam
Wei State (407-225 BC), one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Wei State or Cao Wei 曹魏 (220-265), the most powerful of the Three Kingdoms
imperial order
Sima Guang (1019-1086), politician and historian of Northern Song, author of Comprehensive Mirror for aid in Government 資治通鑒|资治通鉴
an official position/a job in the bureaucracy
